newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PHILIPPINE 91-DAY T-BILL RATE FALLS TO 14.041 PCT.
newsitem.headline: PHILIPPINE 91-DAY T-BILL RATE FALLS TO 14.041 PCT.

text.p: The Philippine 91-day treasury bill yield fell to 14.041 pct from 14.862 last week, the Bureau of Treasury said on Monday.
The 182-day T-bill fell to 14.254 percent from 15.235.
The 364-day T-bill fell to 14.377 percent from 15.667.
The Treasury received bids worth 5.86 billion pesos for the 91-day bills, 6.39 billion for the 182-day bills and 7.214 billion for the 364-day bills.
It accepted 1.5 billion each for the 91-day and 182-day bills and 1.0 billion pesos for the 364-day bills.
National Treasurer Caridad Valdehuesa said the rates were lower than expected.
"I think I see the beginning of normalisation of the market," she told Reuters after the auction.
